channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report X-2024091677
item.description:
Report X-2024091677

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-17
  • City: TACOMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AFTER ARRIVING TO THE INCIDENT FOLLOW THE DECISION TREE THE RESPONSE SHEET FOR CORROSIVE AND OXIDER, CLEAN THE AREA, PUT THE PACKAGE IN A SPILL TUB AND TRANSPORT THE PACKAGE FOR FUTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report I-2024090026
item.description:
Report I-2024090026

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-04
  • City: Seattle
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Shipment was sent by a former employee of company. A ampoule containing between 1 g and 10g of bromine was discovered within a cardboard box in the shipment. There were no hazard labels and it was not properly packaged for shipment. This item was unexpected and undesired. Once identified, it was moved to a separate area in a sealed box until it could be given to a hazardous waste disposal company.

item.title: Report X-2024091475
item.description:
Report X-2024091475

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-26T09:22:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-11
  • City: YAKIMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MSNR location a DG agent noticed haz warnings on the label of a five gallon plastic bucket. The bucket was taken to the spill office where the looked up the SDS and the product was classified as a UN2922. The bucket did not have any DG markings or paperwork needed for transportation. The bucket was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held for the FAA.
